Detailed Description

Simple benchmark suite.

This class allows to store benchmarking results in an automated way. The basic usage is like:

Benchmark benchmark("myNiceBenchmark");
benchmark.output << "some important result" << std::endl"

The result, that a new file called myNiceBenchmark.txt is created in a new folder that is names by the current time stamp in a YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS fashion e.g "2010-02-15_17-02-22". This folder is created in the standard log folder, as defined by the environment variable BRICS_LOGFILES_DIR.

Every new Benchmark after the first one also stores its logfile ins the same time stamp folder. This means one time stamp represents one run of a process, from its creation to its termination. The intention is to repeat a benchmark by relaunching its process. (That allows a benchmark to be scheduled by the operating system or a script.)

Parameters:
benchmarkNameName of the benchmark. The benchmark output will be saved in a file called like this name. A suffix ".txt" is added automatically.
